summary.p: 10 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 24; Qurʾānic Text: Q 50:4-51:15; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 273 x 190/192mm; Script style: kūfī D.I.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 24
10 folios, 190/192×273 mm (1.42). Support: thin transparent parchment of yellowish color. Writing material: light brown ink.
Collation: one quire, H1F H2F H3F S H4F H5F / F6H F7H S F8H F9H F10H.
Text layout: 109/110×183 mm (1.666), 7 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D I. Diacritics absent. Vocalization in golden, red and blue round dots.

Verse markers: individual verses – rosette (type 3.1.2) in gold and red; groups of five verses – letter ﻪ (hā) in gold; groups of ten verses – lace-like medallions resembling large flowers (close to type 2''.С.II), golden with dots of red and blue paint, with abjad letters inscribed in the center (ى – fol. 2r, 10r, ك – fol.4r, ل – fol. 6r, م – fol. 8r).
Title of surah51 (الذريت ستون اية) is inscribed in ornamented panel with the medallion on the outer margin resembling a tree, in gold with small additions of red and blue paint (fol. 9r).

Inscriptions: all the sheets have marks with the surah numbers in Roman numerals and verse numbers in Arabic numerals in pencil or black ink (fol. 9v–10v); on the lower margin of fol. 10v the word variantes is inscribed.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold.
Old conservation: on certain pages (on the flesh side) the text has been refreshed with black ink; the margins probably are cropped.
Defects: the edges of the sheets are mudded; traces of moisture and parchment deterioration cause by aggressive ink on fol. 1; ink peeling off on the flesh sides of the sheets.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with letters “CM.”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink – “10 feuillets, 7 lignes / S. L v. 4 à la fin / S.LI v. 1 à 15” and old accession number in red pencil “B. 2”; on the verso side the name “Monsieur Merlin” inscribed in brown ink.
Old accession numbers: CM (on the wrapping), B. 2 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–9r. Surah 50, verses 4(4)-45(45)*. Incipit: [رجع بعيد] قد علمنا.
Fol. 9r–10v. Surah 51, verses 1(1)-15(15). Explicit: في جنات [وعيون] .
Шукуров Ш. М. Образ человека в искусстве ислама. М., 2004. С. 65."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
